name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

string.description: Application name registered on Google API console.
string.caption: Application Name
string.name: applicationName

string.caption: Consumer Key
string.name: consumerKey

string.description: The OAuth2 consumer secret.
string.caption: Consumer Secret
string.name: consumerSecret

string.description: The OAuth scopes you want to request.
string.caption: Scope
string.name: scope

string.description: Factory to instantiate the underlying google client. Usually you don't need to override this. Most common use case of a custom value here is testing.
string.caption: Client Factory Reference
string.name: clientFactory-ref

enum.description:
This policy represents which id we want to use to represent each google account.
PROFILE means that we want the google profile id. That means, the user's primary key in google's DB. This is a long number represented as a string.
EMAIL means you want to use the account's email address.
enum.caption: Identifier Policy
enum.name: identifierPolicy

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Config Reference
globalRef.name: config-ref

cloud-connector.description: Google Calendars Cloud connector. This connector covers almost all the Google Calendar API v3 using OAuth2 for authentication.

string.description: The timestamp format for timeMin, timeMax and lastUpdated. It defaults to RFC 3369 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).
string.caption: Datetime Format
string.name: datetimeFormat

string.description: Specifies iCalendar UID (iCalUID) of events to be included in the response.
string.caption: Ical U I D
string.name: icalUID

integer.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.
integer.caption: Max Attendees
integer.name: maxAttendees

integer.description: Maximum number of events returned on one result page.
integer.caption: Max Results
integer.name: maxResults

string.description: Lower bound timestamp for an event's last modification time to filter by.
string.caption: Last Updated
string.name: lastUpdated

string.description: The order of the events returned in the result.
string.caption: Order By
string.name: orderBy

string.description: Token specifying which result page to return.
string.caption: Page Token
string.name: pageToken

string.description: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in any field, except for extended properties.
string.caption: Query
string.name: query

string.description: Upper bound timestamp (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by.
string.caption: Time Max
string.name: timeMax

string.description: Lower bound timestamp (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by.
string.caption: Time Min
string.name: timeMin

string.description: Timezone in which timeMin, timeMax and lastUpdated is to be considered on.
string.caption: Timezone
string.name: timezone

boolean.description: Whether to include deleted events (with 'eventStatus' equals 'cancelled') in the result.
boolean.caption: Show Deleted
boolean.name: showDeleted

boolean.description: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result.
boolean.caption: Show Hidden Invitations
boolean.name: showHiddenInvitations

boolean.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events, but not the underlying recurring events themselves.
boolean.caption: Single Events
boolean.name: singleEvents

string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.name: accessTokenId

string.description: The format to be used to parse timeMin and timeMax.
string.caption: Datetime Format
string.name: datetimeFormat

string.description: The end of the interval for the query.
string.caption: Time Max
string.name: timeMax

string.description: The start of the interval for the query.
string.caption: Time Min
string.name: timeMin

string.description: Time zone used in the response.
string.caption: Timezone
string.name: timezone

integer.description: Maximal number of calendars for which FreeBusy information is to be provided.
integer.caption: Max Calendar Expansion
integer.name: maxCalendarExpansion

string.name: calendarId

string.caption: Calendar Event Reference
string.name: calendarEvent-ref

string.caption: Access Token Id
string.name: accessTokenId

string.description: The id of the calendar affected by the rule.
string.caption: Calendar Id
string.name: calendarId

string.description: The email address of a user or group, or the name of a domain, depending on the scope type. Omitted for type "default".
string.caption: Scope
string.name: scope

enum.description: The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: "none" - Provides no access. - "freeBusyReader" Provides read access to free/busy information. "reader" - Provides read access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with reader access, but event details will be hidden. "writer" - Provides read and write access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with writer access, and event details will be visible. "owner" - Provides ownership of the calendar. This role has all of the permissions of the writer role with the additional ability to see and manipulate ACLs.
enum.caption: Role
enum.name: role

enum.description: The type of the scope. Possible values are: - "default" - The public scope. This is the default value. "user" - Limits the scope to a single user. "group" - Limits the scope to a group. "domain" - Limits the scope to a domain. Note: The permissions granted to the "default", or public, scope apply to any user, authenticated or not.
enum.caption: Scope Type
enum.name: scopeType
